advancement.metallurgy.main.deep_iron.de: Venture under an aquatic biome to find and smelt Deep Iron ore.
advancement.metallurgy.main.prometheum.d: Venture into the jungle to find a smelt Prometheum ore.
advancement.metallurgy.main.tin.desc: Obtain your first Tin ore, you notice the material is too ductile to make any useful tool out of it alone.
advancement.metallurgy.main.zinc.desc: Obtain your first Zinc ore, you notice the material is too brittle to make any useful tool out of it alone.
advancement.metallurgy.main.bronze.desc: Obtain your first batch of Bronze by alloying Tin and Copper in a 1:3 ratio.
advancement.metallurgy.main.brass.desc: Obtain your first batch of Brass by alloying Zinc and Copper in a 1:3 ratio.
advancement.metallurgy.main.damascus_ste: Obtain your first batch of Damascus Steel by alloying Iron and Bronze in a 1:2 ratio
advancement.metallurgy.main.tier2.desc: Mine a Tier 2 ore using a tier 1 Pickaxe
advancement.metallurgy.main.osmium.desc: Obtain your first Osmium ore, you notice you struggle to carry it around.
advancement.metallurgy.main.silver.desc: Obtain your first Silver Ore, Extra damage to Undead mobs is not guaranteed!
Obtain your first piece of Infuscolium, seems to have the property of infusing into other metals easily.
advancement.metallurgy.main.manganese.de: Obtain your first Piece of Manganese
advancement.metallurgy.main.angmallen.de: Obtain your first batch of Angmallen, The Power of Elemental creatures underground seems to have been absorbed by common metal, maybe in this form you can exploit it to your advantage?
advancement.metallurgy.main.steel.desc: Make your first batch of Steel
Obtain your first batch of Black Steel, first thing you notice is how sturdy the ingot is, with a lot of work you can probably make some heavy duty tools and armor with it.
advancement.metallurgy.main.electrum.des: Obtain your first batch of Electrum, you notice the metal is highly conductive and make sure to handle it properly, you also wonder how you can make use of that property in some finished product.
advancement.metallurgy.main.hepatizon.de: Obtain your first batch of Hepatizon by alloying Infuscolium with Steel in a 1:1 Ratio
advancement.metallurgy.main.tier3.desc: Mine a Tier 3 ore using a tier 2 Pickaxe
advancement.metallurgy.main.astral_silve: Obtain your first Astral Silver Ore, looking at this metal in the dark shows small sparks of light that align with stars.
advancement.metallurgy.main.ignatius.des: Obtain your first Ignatius Ore, its ingot is still too hot to handle even after letting it cool down for hours, you're worried about what might happen if you drop it in your wooden house.
advancement.metallurgy.main.oureclase.de: Venture in the cracks of the underground to find Oureclase ore, its ingot seems unstable and shows a peculiar property: no matter how many times you try to smooth the surface the ingot always crimps and crushes old bonds.
advancement.metallurgy.main.rubracium.de: Obtain your first Rubracium Ore, looks like it's too brittle to make anything out of it alone but it seems to have absorbed a lot of unrefined power, from the unstable conditions of certain underground sites.
Venture in the highest zones of The Nether to find Shadow Iron Ore, its ingot looks like it's always about to fall into pieces, metal bonds are very weak and you can break them with your bare hands.
Obtain Quicksilver a 1:1 ratio alloy of Silver and Astral Silver, two of the shiniest metals form one that has the power to enhance speed.
advancement.metallurgy.main.tier4.desc: Mine a Tier 4 ore using a tier 3 Pickaxe
advancement.metallurgy.main.ceruclase.de: Obtain your first Ceruclase ore, thermal retention is one of its properties, despite being found in the Nether it remains icy as ever, handling it with your bare hands almost causes freezer burns.
advancement.metallurgy.main.eximite.desc: Obtain your first Eximite Ore, this metal can only be obtained from the Outer End and has ender properties.
advancement.metallurgy.main.kalendrite.d: Obtain your first Kalendrite Ore, this metal has healing properties
advancement.metallurgy.main.midasium.des: Obtain your first Midasium Ore, has the dangerous power of converting other materials into Gold.
advancement.metallurgy.main.orichalcum.d: Obtain your first batch of Orichalcum, you have the feeling some good weaponry and equipment can be made out of it.
advancement.metallurgy.main.platinum.des: Obtain your first Platinum Ore, even in its raw form it's one of the purest metals you've ever seen.
advancement.metallurgy.main.vulcanite.de: Venture in the most dangerous places in the Nether to mine your first piece of Vulcanite, looks like it's about to explode if you fidget too much with it.
advancement.metallurgy.main.celenegil.de: Obtain your first batch of Celenegil by alloying Orichalcum and Platinum in a 1:1 ratio, the new metal stands a league above Orichalcum and provides intense buffs.
advancement.metallurgy.main.amordrine.de: Obtain your first batch of Amordrine by alloying Kalendrite and Platinum in a 1:1 ratio, the new metal enhances the healing properties of Kalendrite making its buffs angelic.
advancement.metallurgy.main.tier5.desc: Mine a Tier 5 ore using a tier 4 Pickaxe
advancement.metallurgy.main.carmot.desc: Obtain your first Carmot Ore, could be used in all kinds of machinery.
advancement.metallurgy.main.lemurite.des: Obtain your first Lemurite Ore, despite being very shiny none of the light comes from it, but is instead reflected and amplified from other light sources.
advancement.metallurgy.main.meutoite.des: Obtain your first Meutoite Ore, its internal structure is ever-changing.
advancement.metallurgy.main.mithril.desc: Obtain your first Mithril Ore, it seems really powerful and has high compatibility with enchantments/magic.
advancement.metallurgy.main.sanguinite.d: Obtain your first piece of Sanguinite Ore, the level of corruption inside this metal is high, but as a tradeoff it is also very powerful.
advancement.metallurgy.main.vyroxeres.de: Obtain your first piece of Vyroxeres Ore,
advancement.metallurgy.main.shadow_steel: Obtain your first batch of Shadow Steel by alloying Shadow Iron and Lemurite in a 2:1 ratio, the alloy has the special property of reacting differently when exposed to light or darkness.
advancement.metallurgy.main.inolashite.d: Obtain your first batch of Inolashite by alloying Alduorite and Ceruclase in a 1:1 ratio, the alloy has the power of affecting timelines stretching, cutting and copying them.
advancement.metallurgy.main.haderoth.des: Obtain your first batch of Shadow Steel by alloying Mithril and Rubracium in a 1:2 ratio, the alloy has the special property of changing shape to adapt to external stimuli.
Obtain your first batch of Desichalkos by alloying Eximite and Meutoite in a 1:1 ratio, this alloy looks somehow linked to the Void and it's absorbing attributes.
advancement.metallurgy.main.krik.desc: Obtain your first batch of Krik by alloying Lutetium and Osmium in a 1:1 ratio, first analyses suggest this metal is not affected by gravity at all, instead it can manipulate when put under mechanical stress.
advancement.metallurgy.main.tier6.desc: Mine a Tier 6 ore using a tier 5 Pickaxe
advancement.metallurgy.main.alduorite.de: Obtain your first Alduorite ore, it shines even if it's still raw!
advancement.metallurgy.main.etherium.des: Obtain your first batch of Etherium by alloying Alduorite and Sanguinite in a 1:1 ratio, it looks like a normal metal but gains ethereal properties when stimulated.
advancement.metallurgy.main.adamantine.d: Obtain your first piece of Adamantine ore, the first metal ever known to be formed in symbiosis with underground microorganisms.
advancement.metallurgy.main.atlarus.desc: Obtain your first piece of Atlarus Ore, legends say the strong wind currents reigned over the places where this metal first formed.
advancement.metallurgy.main.tartarite.de: Obtain your first batch of Tartarite by alloying Adamantine and Atlarus in a 1:1 ratio, this living metal has the power to absorb powers as soon as it enters in contact with the properties of another metal.

gui.jei_compat.crusher.name: 粉碎機
description.jei_compat.tar_processing: 焦油在世界中以液體的形式生成（液態焦油），然而如果它附近沒有別的液態焦油塊，它就會冷卻成焦油礦，然後你可以透過採掘的方式來取得焦油或者瀝青。
description.jei_compat.invisibility_shie: 這個奇特的盾可以在你戰鬥中幫上你許多忙，你可以按住右鍵來格擋並且隱形，從你按住右鍵的那一刻起怪物就不會注意到你。當你放開右鍵時，利莫利亞盾將會根據盾牌使用時長而變更冷卻時間。盾牌有30秒的使用限制，此後盾牌會自動進入冷卻狀態。
description.jei_compat.thermite: 鋁熱劑可以在匠魂冶煉爐中融化，並在冶煉爐燃料罐中作為燃料。這種增強型燃料可以讓你冶煉以前無法冶煉的礦物並且能更快的冶煉普通礦。如果你沒有安裝匠魂，你可以用它來作為任何機器的燃料，特別是冶金的機器。（使冶金機器速度翻倍）
description.jei_compat.krik_armor: 氪裡裝備可以使你懸浮在一定高度，這由你的背包有多少東西來決定。你可以按方向鍵上或者方向鍵下來設定懸浮的高度。你有一個漂浮限制，你不能超過它，這個限制取決於你的背包有多滿。（不包括快捷欄）在你畫面右下角有個HUD，會顯示你目前漂浮高度與限制。

tooltip.metallurgy.effect.adamantine_all: Eating food regenerates equipment durability, not eating any food slowly destroys equipment. Durability repair amount depends on how many food points the item gives. Durability decreases with a frequence of 1 to 6 seconds depending on how hungry the player is
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.adamantine_arm: Receiving fatal damage will cause one of the armor pieces to sacrifice itself. Every Armor piece will increase the chance of surviving death by 25<PC> (with a maximum of 100<PC> when wearing full set)
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.amordrine_armo: Grants extra jumps (from 1 to 4) depending on how many armor pieces the player is wearing
This item will persist in your inventory after death
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.amordrine_weap: Bonus Damage depending on target's health,the more the target has the less health the more damage the weapon does (up to 200<PC> damage boost)
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.angmallen_weap: Deals Bonus Damage to armored enemies
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.angmallen_pick: Mining an ore  sometimes drops another ore of +1/-1/+0 harvest level (50<PC> chance)
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.angmallen_armo: Plays a sound sometimes when you're near some rare ore, every armor piece increases the chance to detect rare ores
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.astral_silver_: Gives Night Vision and Speed depending on how many pieces of armor are worn, effects are only applied when the player is directly under the night-sky or in The End.
45<PC> more damage if the player is in another dimension
Increased speed when breaking blocks in dimensions that aren't the Overworld
A whirlwind barrier will deviate any projectile going towards you from a certain distance.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.atlarus_weapon: A strong gust of wind pushes enemies away from you and breaks leaves and vines in a range of 5 blocks around you
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.atlarus_hoe.to: Wind helps you remove bushes and crops around you
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.black_steel_ar: Receiving damage sometimes grants resistance but also slowness, at the same time. ( Repeated strikes stack the effect, aka slowness I and resistance I become slowness II and resistance II. Can stack up to 3 times, chance based.)
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.black_steel_we: Tools & weapons act like armor, for example holding a black steel sword while getting attacked will damage the sword but absorb a small portion of the damage.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.carmot_tool.to: Harvesting a block will mine surrounding blocks of the same type in a spherical range
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.carmot_armor.t: You can consume and use items faster depending on how many armor pieces you wear; if you wear a full set you also get a Haste III buff
Attacking a mob will also attack mobs of the same type in a radius around the initial strike
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.celenegil_tool: Continuously breaking blocks without stopping doesn't use durability and increases mining speed. (Resets after pausing for more than a second, the unbreakable effect is enabled after 5 blocks mined)
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.celenegil_armo: After being attacked five times over a short period, all the enemies are knocked back away from the player and the player receives a very short regen buff and all negative effects are cleared.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.celenegil_weap: On right click, Grants a small damage buff to the weapon damage but when you damage an entity without killing it, it'll go on a short cooldown while it will give the player some short speed and strength buff if they manage to kill the entity
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.ceruclase_weap: Has a 75<PC> chance to completely freeze an enemy in place on hit for 3 seconds.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.ceruclase_armo: Mobs are slowed, fatigued and weakened depending on how much armor you wear, both players and entities are extinguished if they were on fire.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.ceruclase_tool: Blocks with harvest level of 0 are harvested instantly. (Dirt, sand, Wood)
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.damascus_steel: A minion will be spawned to aid you in your fights against enemies (minion health will scale with the armor count)
Mining ores sometimes grants a bit of experience depending on the harvest level.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.deep_iron_armo: Grants Water Breathing and improved Mobility in water depending on how many armor pieces are worn (it also grants night vision with 2 or more armor pieces).
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.deep_iron_tool: Improved tool harvest speed when underwater (3 times the normal underwater speed)
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.deep_iron_weap: Enhanced weapon damage when underwater (+3 hearts of damage)
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.desichalkos_to: Tool Reach is 3 blocks higher than normal (Metal trait) - Block Drops are teleported to the player inventory directly
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.desichalkos_we: When attacking, the damage is dealt straight to the opponent's health bar, unaffected by armor or any resistance the opponent might have.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.desichalkos_ar: The wearer can fully absorb X instances of damage (X scales with armor) without taking damage, the “Layers” regenerate one at a time every 7 seconds after the last time the wearer took damage.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.electrum_weapo: Activating the effect with a right click on the weapon will cause entities in line of sight of the player to be moved towards the player.
Harvesting blocks while the effect is active (right-click) will make the tool use 10x durability but mine significantly faster and gain a higher harvest level.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.electrum_armor: Receiving damage charges items in the player inventory with Energy. Energy is distributed equally among all items. Energy value scales based on damage received prior to armor reduction calculations.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.etherium_armor: Allows the player to clip through walls when sneaking for at most 15 seconds after which the player remains stuck in the wall
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.etherium_weapo: When attacking, sometimes extra damage is dealt and the user regenerates health equal to the extra damage. If the player has full HP they gain an absorption buff for that amount of hp (Absorption doesn't stack).
Shulkers become neutral, but you're not immune to the effect of lingering bullets.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.eximite_weapon: Grants bonus damage and a looting effect to mobs in the End.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.haderoth_armor: ONLY ACTIVE AFTER THE ARMOR IS REBORN<NL>Each armor piece gives has a different: <NL>helmet: immunity to hunger effect, <NL>chestplate: fire resistance, <NL>leggings: immunity to slowness effect, <NL>boots: immunity to levitation effect
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.haderoth_weapo: ONLY ACTIVE AFTER THE WEAPON IS REBORN<NL>Killing the same mob over and over again grants bonus damage, but killing a different one resets it
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.haderoth_all.t: Items have a second life, once they reach 0 durability they're replaced by a new and better version of themselves; <NL> Armor pieces will be reborn with higher durability and protection and toughness values; <NL> All items will will be reborn higher durability and increased efficiency when breaking blocks, weapons also get a 1 heart permanent bonus damage.<NL> (all the other Haderoth effects are enabled after items are reborn).
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.hepatizon_weap: When attacking you have a chance to rob the enemy of some of their equipment.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.hepatizon_armo: Grants AI invisibility outside of a certain radius depending on how much armor you're wearing.
Auto-smelts block drops if they can be smelted.<NL>Auto-smelt chance is based on the Fortune enchantment
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.ignatius_weapo: Auto-smelts entity loot if they can be smelted.<NL>Auto-smelt chance is based on the Fortune enchantment
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.ignatius_armor: Fire and lava heals you proportionally to the damage it would otherwise deal, but water and rain damages you as if it were lava and fire; <NL>The effect of Fire Protection is inverted, to protect water damage.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.inolashite_wea: When attacking, sometimes an extra attack can occur, the player will swing his arm twice in quick succession.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.inolashite_too: Upon activation, transports the player 7 blocks in the direction they are looking breaking all the blocks in the way (as long as the tool can harvest them).
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.inolashite_arm: Shift + Jump will teleport the player back in time of 2..8 seconds depending on how much armor is worn
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.kalendrite_arm: If the player has not received any damage for the past 10 seconds and they don't have full hp, they gain a regeneration buff.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.kalendrite_too: Breaking blocks restores half a heart but tools lose more durability the lower the user's health is.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.krik_armor.too: Makes you float at a certain height depending on how much filled your inventory is. You can press the UP arrow or the DOWN arrow to float respectively up and down.  You have a height limit you can't go over while floating, that limit depends on how full your inventory is (excluding the hotbar). There's also an HUD in the bottom-right corner of the screen that shows you, your height level and your limit.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.krik_tool.tool: Activating the item launches the player in the general direction of where they are looking.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.krik_weapon.to: Deals double damage to airborne entities and gives a short levitation debuff.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.midasium_hoe.t: Harvesting crops with this hoe will turn the crop drops into gold items (ingots, dusts and nuggets) instead.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.midasium_weapo: Chance based looting effect that stacks with the looting enchantment. All drops have a small chance to be turned into gold ingots.
Chance based fortune effect that stacks with the fortune enchantment. All drops have a small chance to be turned into gold ingots.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.mithril_pickax: Breaking ore sometimes drops an additional ore along with the one mined. Effect chance scales with Fortune Enchantment
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.mithril_weapon: Deals additional magic damage 1 second after the last entity was attacked
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.mithril_all.to: The more enchantments the item has the better it performs. (damage for weapons, mining speed for tools and more protection from armor)
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.orichalcum_all: Killing monsters restores durability to Orichalcum Items (Amount is equal to the max health of the killed monster)
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.orichalcum_arm: Killing a mob grants a strength buff, level of which is equal to the count of every other remaining hostile mob around the wearer. (Max Potion Level: 6) (Armor scales the radius and duration of the bonus)
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.osmium_armor.t: Enemies are knocked back when they attack you
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.oureclase_pick: Mining ores drops 1 dust of that metal instead of the ore.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.oureclase_weap: Deals 2x the original damage to enemies with full health.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.oureclase_armo: Sprinting slightly damages and knocks back nearby entities.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.platinum_armor: Purifies negative effects like Weakness, Slowness and Poison to their positive counterparts.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.platinum_weapo: Extra cathartic damage will be dealt to undead enemies as well as setting them on fire.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.prometheum_arm: Shifting affects nearby crops and grass growth giving it a boost at the cost of a bit of armor durability.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.prometheum_all: Item durability regenerates slowly overtime when under direct sunlight.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.prometheum_hoe: When harvested with this hoe: leaves, crops and grass drops are increased.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.quicksilver_we: On every successful attack you're launched through the enemy damaging them more.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.quicksilver_al: Equipping this item gives you a speed boost.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.quicksilver_to: Mining speed will remain the same over any block independently from harvest level or block hardness
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.quicksilver_ar: Sprinting will allow you to build up momentum, once full speed is reached you'll be able to run on liquids, but you will sink as soon as you stop or slow down.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.sanguinite_all: This item will disappear completely after death.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.sanguinite_wea: You deal more damage as you grow hungry, killing enemies appeases your hunger depending on the max health of the enemy but also makes you hungry for more.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.sanguinite_too: Activating the tool will exchange some of your life for increased harvest speed and level also restoring a bit of durability
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.sanguinite_arm: Killing a hostile mob might revive its corpse with lower health allowing it to be killed again for more drops and experience.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.shadow_iron_pi: Mining Shadow Iron ore will sometimes drop a different ore.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.shadow_iron_we: Attacks occasionally become critical hits dealing random increased damage up to more than 3 times the base attack value.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.shadow_iron_ar: Has a chance of absorbing attack damage completely at the cost of durability from one of the armor pieces
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.shadow_steel_a: (WIP DESC) This item regenerates durability in the darkness, regen speed is relative to the darkness level
Whether if you're attacked in light or in darkness you either blind and damage enemies with fire or evade anymore damage and gain speed boost for a few seconds
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.shadow_steel_w: This weapon hits faster in the dark and stronger in the light.
Surrounding the item with 4 blocks of another metal will allow it to absorb its effects in an increased ratio while also increasing item durability.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.vulcanite_weap: Right clicking the weapon ignites it, and on the next strike within 5 seconds will create an explosion whose strength depends on how much time is left on the fuse, if 5 seconds run out before you attack any enemy the explosion will affect the user.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.vulcanite_tool: Breaking a block has a chance of breaking another one adjacent to it, chance scales with fortune.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.vulcanite_armo: Receiving damage causes explosions that damage all the entities around the player damage scales with armor level, when more than 2 pieces are worn explosions also cause fire in the area around and the user is given 10 seconds of fire resistance.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.vyroxeres_weap: Poisons the target on every hit, if the target is already poisoned, the level of poison debuff increases.
tooltip.metallurgy.effect.vyroxeres_armo: Additional Damage Reduction for every active potion effect on the user.
tooltip.metallurgy.gauntlet_effect_disab: §4因為載入了Better With Mods，所以停用了手套效果
tooltip.metallurgy.thermite: §c與煤同等強度的燃料（在冶金機械中效果最好，可以達到200%的效率！）[在JEI中查看更多訊息]
tooltip.metallurgy.clear_detector_warnin: §4警告：這會清除金屬探測儀中所有啟動的金屬
tooltip.metallurgy.etherium_goggles: §4Wear them in your helmet slot to see redstone related blocks and circuits behind walls
tooltip.metallurgy.electrum_magnet: §eAttracts dropped items on the ground (Has 3 different modes)
message.metallurgy.water_damage_death: %s tried to swim in water while wearing Ignatius Armor
util.world_join_message.3: §6錯誤報告、建議或者更多訊息，請點擊GitHub連結：
